results.title: The Island
results.brief_description: The spirit of volunteerism is alive and well in Jamieson, in north-eastern Victoria, where a small group of retirees have painstakingly transformed an overgrown eyesore into a beautiful recreational park the whole town can enjoy. Once an inaccessible, snake-ridden wilderness, this patch of land between the Goulburn and Jamieson rivers (not a true island) has had a storied history. Although subject to a few set backs after recent flooding, this gang of ex-farmers explain how it was with sheer hard work that they were able to turn around the fortunes of the Island and restore it to the local community.

results.title: Embracing difference: supporting autism in Mansfield
results.creator_credit: Jessica Scott, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Mansfield, in north-eastern Victoria, is home to groundbreaking services for Autistic children and their families. With a history dating back to the 1960s, when pioneering Doctor Joan Curtis held the first Family Camps for children with Autism, Mansfield has been uniquely engaged with their Autistic community. Now boasting a world-leading set of services, ‘Embracing Difference’ explores the variety of ways Mansfield empowers people in the community with Autism to live full, satisfying and independent lives.

group.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Mansfield Shire

group_siblings.title: Three stories of agriculture in Mansfield

results.title: A Tale of two cinemas
results.brief_description: A cinema can be much more than a place to see movies, as this story of the old Mansfield Cinema, and its modern counterpart – the totally digital Mansfield Armchair Cinema – explores. When the old Mansfield Cinema closed down, the town lost its cultural centre. Years on, it took the brainwave of a local accountant and a lot of community support, to resurrect cinema in Mansfield, located in north-eastern Victoria. Building from strength to strength, Armchair Cinema is unique in that it was the first totally digital cinema in Victoria and it is almost exclusively run by teenagers from the local high school.

results.title: Building in Tolmie
results.brief_description: The Valcich’s fell in love with Tolmie, in north-eastern Victoria, the moment they saw it – 12 years on, they are still building their dream home on their block of paradise. Little by little they have assembled a unique and sustainable home using timber and stone from their land and a multitude of reclaimed materials. These gentle souls tell us a little bit about what Tolmie means to them and how they have been able to contribute to the community through the CFA and various social groups over the years.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Mansfield Shire
results.brief_description: ‘ACMI in the regions: stories from Mansfield Shire’ takes a look at the towns of Mansfield, Tolmie and Jamieson, located in north-eastern Victoria. Interviews with the locals provide a sense of the rich history of these towns and the lifeblood that keeps them thriving.

results.title: Why we luv Jammo
results.brief_description: A diverse cross-section of the “Jammo” community tell us why they’ve chosen this particular slice of heaven to call home. The post-mistress, the erstwhile town photographer, the caravan park operator and a handful of other locals, explain how they came to live in Jamieson (located in north-eastern Victoria) and how the peace, quiet and stunning natural beauty have convinced them there is really no better place to live. The rustling of the wind in the trees, native bird calls and tinkling waterways contribute a natural soundtrack which helps evoke this unique place.

results.title: The Milky way = Dairy farming in Maffra
results.brief_description: This film showcases farming in the Maffra region and features six farmers who are leading the way in innovation and new farming technologies. Alan Clyne and his son Allister together with Robert White and John White are involved in the Herd Improvement initiative. Graeme Anderson and his son Ross are making the most of new irrigation techniques. Max Warren introduces his Robotic Dairy, the first ever to be used in Australia.

group.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Maffra
group.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI

group_siblings.title: Young voices of Maffra = Future leaders : Young voices of Maffra

results.title: Young voices of Maffra = Future leaders : Young voices of Maffra
results.brief_description:
This film focuses on the young people of Maffra. Eight students from Maffra Secondary College were interviewed, representing all the year levels, and asked to talk about life in a regional town, their hopes for the future and issues that affect them and their world.
The end result is a portrait of young rural Victorians who are thoughtful and engaging, with concerns about the environment, world politics and the survival of small towns.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Maffra
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vox pops with the locals of Maffra. The township of Maffra in the Wellington Shire, southeast of Victoria, is home to approximately 4000 people and was chosen to host the third annual Small Towns Summit from 26 to 27 August 2009. The summit is an initiative of the Small Towns Victoria Program funded by Regional Development Victoria, organised by the Municipal Association of Victoria. The program aims to broadly address the issues facing small rural towns in Victoria.

Young voices of Maffra = Future leaders : Young voices of Maffra

results.title: Welcome to Maffra
results.brief_description: This film starts with Darren McCubbin, the Mayor of the Wellington Shire, welcoming the audience to Maffra. Darren explains that we are about to visit some of the places and meet some of the people that make Maffra a unique place to live. The film features the Geoff Webster Centre, the Gippsland Vehicle Collection, the Maffra Gymnastics Club, the George Gray Centre, Wallaby Rise Restaurant, Cambrai Backpacker Hostel and Jenny McDavitt an Alpaca farmer and Ferial Zikerman who is now internationally known for her Maffra Cheese.
